meanings.sent1: The troubled teen was sent to juvie for stealing a candy bar.
meanings.sent2: The judge decided to send the young offender to juvie for a month.
meanings.sent3: When the mischievous boy kept causing trouble, his parents joked about sending him to juvie.
meanings.sent4: The juvie loomed in the distance, a stark reminder of the consequences of his actions.
meanings.sent5: The cold, gray walls of juvie seemed to swallow him whole, filling him with regret.

meanings.definition: A young person who has committed a crime.
meanings.sent1: The police officer apprehended the juvie who had been shoplifting at the mall.
meanings.sent2: The community center aimed to provide support and guidance for juveniles at risk of becoming juvies.
meanings.sent3: The group of juvies thought they could outsmart the authorities, but they were mistaken.
meanings.sent4: In the eyes of the law, he was no longer just a kid but a juvie, facing the consequences of his actions.
meanings.sent5: The label of juvie weighed heavily on his shoulders, a constant reminder of his past mistakes.
